Reviews.Title: Acquired Taste
Reviews.Author: PalmMan
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Palm Pre since it first hit the market, and was in direct competition with the I-Phone. Even though the Palm Pre was abandoned by Palm and sold to HP who shelved it. It is still competetive in the cell phone market. This Primarily due to the fact that the initial technology was so far advanced. If more apps were created for this phone and the manufacturers would get behind it I think this phone could still flourish, A lot of consumers such as myself are looking for alternatives to I-Phones. For me personally the phone meets most of my personal and business needs, an as long as it available I belive I will be an owner.

Reviews.Title: Quality extremely low
Reviews.Author: Paulo
Reviews.Content: Phone was scratched and damaged more that the description, I needed it as an emergency but after seeing the conditions I decided not to use it...

Reviews.Title: good back up
Reviews.Author: Mannie C.
Reviews.Content: not even a 3G but it was good as far as battery life, lasted me 2 days with out charging(smart phones cant do) good back up phone i keep it in my car just in case

Reviews.Title: What I Needed
Reviews.Author: Jamal Fruster
Reviews.Content: Just what I needed. Although there is better technology out, the Palm Pre does what I need it to do. I use it for work and business a lot. It's sleek, clean and efficient.

Reviews.Title: Listed Refurbished Phone as New - Misleading
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: The seller represented the Palm Pre phone I bough as NEW. The phone arrived in a generic Sprint box not specific to the model, and it had a user manual from a later version of the phone - the Verizon Palm Pre 2, which is a different handset with different hardware.  After a memory problem came up in the first week I took the phone into the Sprint store and they told me it was refurbished.  I also checked ##786# diagnostics and it shows a recondition date.  I emailed the seller stating I was overcharged because the phone was listed as a new handset but it was actually reconditioned.  I requested a partial refund and the correct user manual but got no response.  The phone looked unblemished when it came and it works OK but I think I overpaid and I had to download and print the manual myself.  I'm not a satisfied customer since I was overcharged and got no response from the seller about my issues.  Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: regret purchase
Reviews.Author: aPelink
Reviews.Content: product worked first two days, after the phone started acting up and now i cant even hear anything when making a phone call. regret purchase

Reviews.Title: Do not use headphones on this
Reviews.Author: Devon
Reviews.Content: There is an issue with the phone that will lock it in headset mode, even when the headset is removed. Several of the "fixes" are temporary and there's no long term solution

Reviews.Title: Nothing Too Special
Reviews.Author: Sophia Doan
Reviews.Content: It's okay for a temporary phone. Navigation works well and I love the keyboard. The touchstone charging kit that came with it no longer worked. None of the apps will download and for some reason it won't let me save any contacts. Wouldn't really recommend it to a friend if they were looking for a temporary phone.

Reviews.Title: I LIKE
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: I ONLY BOUGHT THIS PHONE BECAUSE IT REMINDED ME OF MY CHILDHOOD AND BECAUSE OF ITS INNOVATIVE DESIGN BUT OTHER THAN THAT THIS PHONE IT'S OKAY IT'S NOT GREAT THE KEYBOARD IS WAY TOO SMALL BUT IT'S A COOL  THE PHONE

Reviews.Title: Pre-View
Reviews.Author: sandra young
Reviews.Content: I must say that I am pleasantly suprised! My order arrived in 48 hours, I was skeptical about what the condition of the phone would be and I must say, this was The Deal I Needed!!! This is my second Palm Pre, the docking is cool and Pandora is even better because all my music is free. I had an iPhone and compared to this I'm good. I'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: Palm Pre Phone (Sprint)
Reviews.Author: John O
Reviews.Content: I was in line and got my first Palm Pre the very day it was released. I have loved it ever since. It's a brilliantly designed OS and cell phone. I'm hard-of-hearing, so the calling parts has little value for me. I e-mail, txt, and read NewsRoom a lot on it. It's very convenient. I especially love the ability to have an unlimited no call list on the cell phone, and won't even go to voice mail. I had my original cell phone for some 3.5 years... recently the screen cracked from running after the city buss and I dropped it. The battery was at the end of it's life, and I was going to just replace that, but the screen became to unreliable... Thankfully for me I was able to get another brand new one here in Amazon. Paying $120 this time while including a touch tone and Palm leather case, I was thrilled, I paid some $300 just for the cell phone 3.5 years ago. I was able to go online to Sprint, beside my cell phone I hit activate a new cell phone, Did that and typed in the special cell ID, and in minutes I was already on my new cell, I feel so brand new again! The only thing I wish would be for the ability of the Pre 3 to run on Sprint, I so wish that was possible, apparently the Verison's CDMA is not like the Sprint's CDMA and therefore won't work. All in all, I am happy with this cell phone and really wish webOS was still alive in the mainstream. Palm Pre Phone (Sprint)

Reviews.Title: dissapointed
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: the day i recieved the phone, i let the phone charge.  once i put the phone on a blue screen showed up and said there was an error and unable to be resolved. i brought it to sprint. the tech tried to reset it and other stuff. after a 15 min wait  he told me that they had sent me a damaged phone. now i have to send this phone back and do this and that then wait to recieve a nother one...im hoping this one works. now i have to pay for shipping and handling  out of pocket on a phone thats crap.
